alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 3:48PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL ST. TAMMANY PARISH, WEST CENTRAL HANCOCK AND SOUTHWESTERN PEARL RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM CDT... At 348 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Picayune, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Picayune, Pearl River, Stennis Space Center, Lacombe, and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 266 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi near mile marker 1. Interstate 12 between mile markers 69 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany
